Marcie reveals that the idea of burning two cheerleaders alive came from a journal in her old "Killing Club" from high school. Viki urges Marcie to do something to make it right and help the police find Natalie.
2. Nora is worried that she may have contracted H.I.V. from her ex-husband, Daniel, and confides in Bo about her fears. Bo reassures her that she did the right thing by getting tested and that she will be okay. Nora expresses her distrust in people and her fear of the unknown future.
3. John is determined to find Natalie and regrets not being able to save her. Marcie feels guilty for writing the book and offers to help John by making phone calls to old "Killing Club" members to find more information. John asks Marcie to make the calls from the station for safety reasons.

1. Tess and Nash are having a conversation about their dreams and aspirations. Tess reveals that she wants to be free from her old life and have her own dreams, while Nash encourages her to find her own vineyard.
2. Marcie and Rex are trying to escape from Hayes Barber, who has kidnapped them. Marcie is worried about Natalie, but Rex assures her that they will find her.
3. Dorian and David are discussing the seating arrangements for their wedding. Dorian wants Viki to be her matron of honor, but David is not comfortable with the idea.
4. Blair and Starr are having a conversation about Starr's social life. Starr is upset because she feels like an outcast, and Blair apologizes for not realizing that she was still upset about Margaret Cochran.
5. Todd is trying to set up a stock portfolio for Jessica, but he has lost touch with her. He asks Rich if he has talked to her, and Rich reveals that he has met with her earlier that day.
6. Tess and Rich are meeting to discuss the transfer of funds. Tess is surprised to learn that Rich has turned up additional funds for her.
7. John, Bo, and Michael are trying to save Nick from bleeding to death. Nick reveals that Natalie is dead, and Michael starts performing CPR on him.

1. Antonio's custody case is reopened, and he is granted joint custody of his daughter Jamie with Keri Reynolds.
2. Al Holden's health deteriorates, and he requires a liver transplant to survive.
3. Todd plays the piano for Blair, expressing his feelings for her, and they share a dance.
4. David Vickers reveals his love for Dorian to Kelly, who remains skeptical.

1. Rex is found in the women's steam room by Kelly, but he claims it's a mistake. Kelly gets stuck in the steam room and Rex helps her out, leading to a conversation about their respective love lives.
2. Gigi is upset with Rex for implying to Adriana that they are not having sex. Adriana enjoys causing drama between Gigi and Rex.
3. Ford and James have a strained relationship with their father, Eddie, who has just been released from jail and plans to stay with them.
4. Starr and Cole have a tearful goodbye as Cole prepares to go to prison for 10 years. Cole asks Starr to move on and be happy for his sake.
5. Natalie had an amniocentesis test without informing John, causing tension between the couple. John is upset that Natalie made a major decision without consulting him.
6. Inez, Nate, Ford, and James have a tense encounter with Eddie, who has a history of abuse towards his family. Inez takes a firm stance against Eddie and protects her sons.
7. Markko and Langston say their goodbyes as Markko returns to UCLA. Markko encourages Langston to move on and find happiness.

1. Whitney, a tennis player, and Chad, a musician, are discussing Whitney's desire to become a singer. Whitney has been feeling angry with her mother, Eve, due to her mother's relationship with Julian Crane. Despite her mother's disapproval, Whitney has decided to pursue a singing career.
2. Meanwhile, Rebecca, Julian's wife, is plotting to destroy the lives of Theresa and her family. Rebecca has gotten Theresa and Luis fired from their jobs and has also gotten Luis suspended from the police force.
3. Rebecca's ultimate goal is to adopt Theresa's son, Ethan, as her own. Rebecca has been slowly driving a wedge between Theresa and her family, and her latest scheme involves getting Ethan to side with her against his own mother.
4. Rebecca has asked Ethan, who is a lawyer for Crane Industries, to evict Theresa's family from their home. Ethan is hesitant to do so, as he knows that the family will have nowhere to go.
5. Rebecca threatens to fire Ethan if he does not comply with her request. She also reminds him of the pain and suffering that Theresa has caused his own family in the past.
6. Ethan ultimately decides to go through with the eviction, knowing that it will cause further pain and suffering for Theresa and her family. Rebecca is pleased with his decision, as it brings her one step closer to her goal of adopting Ethan.
7. Meanwhile, Whitney has decided to take a job singing at a local club. She is excited about the opportunity, but is also nervous about what her mother will think.
8. Despite her reservations, Whitney goes through with the performance. She is a huge success, and her mother, Eve, is in the audience. Eve is furious about Whitney's decision to pursue a singing career, and the two of them get into a heated argument.

1. T.C. is proud of his daughter Eve and wants to speak to her about Whitney's latest tennis trophy. However, Eve is still at work, keeping an eye on her friend Sheridan who was injured in a fire. T.C. is disappointed that Eve is not home yet, but he understands her responsibilities as a doctor.
2. Meanwhile, Luis is worried about Sheridan's condition and wants to sit with her, but he has to wait for Dr. Russell's approval. Antonio is also concerned about his wife's health and tries to call her, but the nurse informs him that there was a fire at their home, and Sheridan is in the hospital.
3. At the hospital, Tom Joyner confronts Julian Crane about his past actions as a whistleblower. Rebecca, who is with Julian, tries to help him change his mind about killing Tom. Tom considers shooting Julian and taking the money, but Rebecca talks him out of it, reminding him that he would be a murderer and might have to spend the rest of his life in jail.

1. Whitney's decision to give up her baby for adoption has caused a rift between her parents, T.C. and Eve, and their respective partners, Liz and Julian. T.C. blames Eve for Whitney's decision and expresses his desire to adopt the baby with Liz, while Julian suggests he wants to be a part of Endora's life. However, Tabitha is against Julian's involvement, leading to a heated argument.

2. Meanwhile, Gwen and Theresa's conflict over Jane intensifies as Gwen threatens to kill Theresa. Katherine intervenes and tries to calm the situation, reminding them of the impact on Jane. Despite her animosity towards Theresa, Gwen ultimately decides not to harm her, showing growth in her character.

1. Whitney and Chad are planning to move to LA together, which T.C. is against. However, Whitney's mother, Eve, has changed her mind and is now supporting Whitney's decision. This has caused a rift between Eve and T.C., and Liz, Eve's sister, is enjoying seeing the discord. Meanwhile, Sheridan has left Harmony and is in Paris, and Antonio is happy knowing she is safe and relaxing. However, Beth is disappointed because she had hoped that Sheridan's disappearance would bring Luis back to her.
2. Kay's water has broken, and she is in labor, even though the baby is not due for several weeks. Grace, Simone, and Pilar are trying to help her stay calm and get to the hospital. Meanwhile, Tabitha is trying to keep Charity from discovering that she is not really pregnant. Tabitha is worried that Charity will reveal the truth about the demon child she is carrying.
3. Julian has admitted to setting the fire at Liz's club, but he claims it was an accident. Sam is not convinced and is starting an investigation. Liz is worried about the legal consequences of the fire and the fact that people were almost killed. T.C. is angry with Julian for almost causing Whitney's death. Luis is determined to find Sheridan and restart the search, even though Antonio and everyone else believe she is in Paris.

1. Spike, Noah, Sam, Simone, Paloma, and Jessica are having an intervention for Jessica to stop her from being abused by Spike. Spike and Sam get into a physical altercation, and Jessica begs them to stop. Spike manipulates Jessica into not testifying against him in court.

2. Endora, Maria, Tabitha, Fox, and Miguel are at the Bennett house. Endora and Maria have eaten chocolate that Endora stole, and Fox is trying to figure out where she got it from. Miguel tells Kay that he will always love her, no matter what.

3. Fancy and Chris are outside, discussing their insecurities about Luis and Sheridan being in the same house. They both express their fears that Sheridan still has feelings for Luis. Fancy and Chris hear thunder and realize it is raining, and they go inside.

4. Luis and Sheridan are in a cottage on the estate, and Luis is trying to convince Sheridan that she still has feelings for him. Sheridan insists that she loves Chris and wants to be a good wife and mother. Luis eventually holds Sheridan, and she does not stop him.

5. Gwen, Ethan, Jared, and Theresa are in a hotel room, trying to have a romantic evening. Gwen and Ethan hear lovemaking sounds coming from outside their room. They assume it is Jared and Theresa, but it is actually Rebecca and J.T. on the ledge outside. Ethan and Gwen eventually give up on finding out where the sounds are coming from and go to bed.

1. Kay and Miguel are excited to get married and raise Maria together, but they are worried about how to tell Fox, who has been good to Kay and Maria. Fox, however, is determined to win Kay back and plans to show her that he can provide a better life for Maria than Miguel can. Julian advises Fox to emphasize his ability to give Maria the best schools, house, and everything else she deserves.
2. Miguel and Kay discuss their past relationships and how they led them to each other. Miguel acknowledges that Fox was there for Kay and Maria when he wasn't, but he promises to make up for lost time and be a good husband and father. Kay feels guilty about breaking off her engagement to Fox, but Miguel urges her to do it as soon as possible so that it will be easier for everyone.
3. Rebecca impersonates Gwen in bed with Ethan to keep him from realizing that Gwen is gone. She struggles with her conscience but ultimately decides to continue the ruse until Gwen returns. Meanwhile, Gwen and Theresa compete to pay J.T. the most money to win Ethan's favor. J.T. plays them against each other and promises to give the winner Ethan's affections.
4. Luis, Sheridan, Paloma, and Chris search for Fancy, who has been missing for some time. Chris leads them to a cave where Fancy's cell phone was last tracked. Luis accuses Chris of having something to do with Fancy's disappearance, but Sheridan defends him. Chris explains that he came to the cave based on a hunch and a vague memory of overhearing a conversation.
5. Fox receives bad news from his doctor and jokes with the doctor about his test results. Kay and Miguel overhear the conversation and realize that Fox is dying. Fox asks the doctor not to tell Kay yet so that she can enjoy their wedding day without worrying about his health. Kay is touched by Fox's selflessness and decides not to tell him about her plans to marry Miguel.
6. Rebecca continues to impersonate Gwen in bed with Ethan. She enjoys the experience but ultimately decides that it is wrong and stops before they have sex. Meanwhile, Gwen and Theresa compete to pay J.T. the most money to win Ethan's favor. J.T. declares Gwen the winner and Theresa storms off,

1. Karen offers to help Kevin find a treatment program for his addiction, but he is hesitant and wants to speak with Frank instead.
2. Chris is helping Ian with his vampire condition, but Ian becomes agitated when Chris asks about his increased need for blood.
3. Lucy is struggling with the loss of her slayer powers and feels useless, but Elizabeth asks her to help find Alison who has been kidnapped by Joshua.
4. Jamal has been turned into a vampire and is working for Joshua, but Rafe confronts him and demands to know where Alison is being held.
5. Joshua reveals to Alison that he was friends with her father growing up and that her father helped him gain the power and wealth he has today.

1. Sharon is seeking Victor's help in proving Adam's innocence, but Victor refuses, stating that Adam created his own situation. Sharon believes that Victor is the only one who can help her set things right.
2. Neil and Sofia are upset with Blake for submitting a poor quality report, and they plan to fire him. Cane tries to defend Blake, but Neil and Sofia are not convinced.
3. Colin is determined to see his grandchildren and pressures Blake to find a way to get into the house. Lily has to leave due to a babysitter emergency, and Colin is disappointed that he cannot see the twins.
4. Jill is trying to reach Lauren's doctor to cancel her appointments, but he is not available. Sharon is still trying to convince Victor to help Adam, but Victor remains firm in his decision.
5. Faith is done waiting for Sharon to be a real mother, and Nick plans to file for full custody as soon as Michael is free. Phyllis regrets not keeping Daisy in prison and is worried about losing Daniel.
6. A man has been found unconscious in the snow, and the police suspect that Daisy is responsible. The man is identified as Daniel, and he is suffering from severe hypothermia and a head injury.
7. The police have found a tire tread in the snow that matches Jana's car, and they believe that Daisy is the one who left Daniel in the snow. Phyllis is determined to find Daisy and confront her.
8. Neil and Sofia are discussing the poor quality report when Cane arrives. They inform him that they plan to fire Blake, and Cane is surprised.
9. Colin is disappointed that he cannot see the twins, and Blake tries to make excuses for Lily. Colin is not satisfied and tells Blake to keep an eye on Lily, nothing else.
10. Michael shows Jack a picture of Daisy taken at an A.T.M. in Canada, and they know that she is far away. Phyllis is still worried about Daniel and the missing baby.

1. Victor Newman is in a legal battle with his daughters, Victoria and Abby, over the control of his company's assets. The forensic accounting report shows no wrongdoing on Victor's part, but new information has come to light regarding the sale of a major holding in Dubai.
2. Victoria and Abby's lawyer, Vance Abrams, argues that Victor is selling off the company's assets to undermine the proceedings and devalue the company. Victor denies these claims and says he has no intention of dismantling his company.
3. The judge considers Vance's request to freeze one-third of Newman Enterprises' assets in escrow until the conclusion of the legal proceedings. Michael, Victor's lawyer, argues against this request.
4. Victor accuses Victoria of lying and destroying the very company that built the family. Victoria defends herself by saying that Victor has justified his actions in the past by convincing himself that they were for the best for the family or the company.
5. Sharon meets with the district attorney, Spencer Walsh, to present evidence that Skye Lockhart is alive and in Hawaii. Spencer is unconvinced and threatens to reconsider obstruction charges against Sharon.
6. Jack Abbott is in Hawaii, searching for Skye Lockhart. He finds the shack where she was living and speaks to a man named Chester who may have seen her.
7. Nina visits Ronan Malloy to offer him part of her liver for a transplant. Ronan is initially resistant, but Nina insists that she wants to help him, even if it means pushing him away.
8. Nina tells Ronan that she found his doctor and was tested to see if she is a compatible donor. Ronan is upset that Nina went behind his back and contacted his doctor.
9. Heather and Paul listen to the recording of Chance's wire the night he was shot. Paul believes that the shot that killed Chance was not loaded, and Ronan was shooting blanks.
10. The judge orders one-third of Newman Enterprises' assets to be frozen in escrow, much to Victor's dismay. He accuses Victoria and Abby of destroying the company and threatens them with the consequences of their actions.

1. Lily, Cane, and Tyler are at Jabot discussing a new fragrance campaign. Lily is called away to meet with Jack, leaving Cane and Tyler to discuss the presentation. Meanwhile, Neil and Leslie are at Jabot as well, discussing Neil's recent rehiring and Leslie's behavior. Chelsea is also at Jabot, meeting with Cane about her fashion designs.

2. At the police station, Jamie is being questioned about the incident on the roof. Michael and Lauren are trying to get to the bottom of what happened, while Paul is trying to calm Jamie down. Fenmore arrives at the station, and Jamie accuses him of pushing him off the roof. Michael struggles with the possibility that his own son may be responsible for Jamie's injuries.

1. Victor Newman is upset with his son, Nick, for arranging to buy Jabot's debt and intending to foreclose, which will result in Victor's wife, Nikki, losing her job.
2. Nick justifies his actions by saying it's a smart and ruthless move, similar to what Victor would do. He believes Victor should focus on his family instead of work.
3. Jack Abbott, CEO of Jabot, has called an emergency meeting with the shareholders as Nicholas and Victor have bought up all of Jabot's debt with the intention of foreclosing.
4. Jill, a shareholder, is shocked and can't believe Nicholas would do this to them. Jack is disappointed but believes they can still convince their father, John, to help them.
5. Meanwhile, Drucilla is concerned about her family's privacy as Malcolm has been going through her mail. She is worried about Phyllis finding out about the paternity test results.
6. Phyllis has already figured out that there is a secret in the family and warns Drucilla about the consequences of keeping such a big secret.
7. Lily is making a collage for her father in the hospital and is upset that Devon is still upset about not celebrating his birthday.
8. Devon is tired of Lily always thinking she knows what he wants and tells her to back off. He is also worried about the tension between Malcolm and Drucilla.
9. Malcolm is waiting for Olivia's test results and is worried about how Drucilla will react if he is Lily's father. Olivia reassures him that they will find a way to deal with the truth, no matter what it is.

1. Jack and Sharon are packing up boxes from the Abbott mansion, as Jack has been forced to split the furnishings with Gloria due to the court's decision. Gloria is excited about the mansion being hers, but Kevin and Jana decline her invitation to a housewarming party, causing Gloria to realize that her sons are still angry with her.

2. At Jabot, Alistair Wollingford, an actor hired to play the role of John Abbott, meets with Jill and Kay to discuss his portrayal of John. They mention that Gloria married Jeffrey for unknown reasons and discuss the qualities of John, such as his brilliance, kindness, and generosity. Alistair is eager to embody John and impress Gloria.

3. At Newman Enterprises, Adam and Victoria discuss the Beauty of Nature campaign. Adam disagrees with Victoria's choice for the spokesperson, and they argue about his behavior towards her in the company. Adam reveals that his mother appeared in his dream and shared her happiness about their recent conversation.

4. Victor meets with Sabrina at an art gallery, where they view various pieces, including those by Jeff Koons and Damien Hirst. Sabrina discusses the artists' styles and meanings behind their work, and Victor shares his admiration for their boldness. Victor and Sabrina seem to grow closer as they continue to explore the gallery.

1. Victor Newman's son, Adam, has been identified as the body found in the Athletic Club basement through DNA testing. The family will be contacted to make arrangements for his burial.
2. The investigation into Adam's death is being treated as a homicide, and a search warrant is executed at the Newman ranch. The police are looking for a murderer.
3. Nick Newman wonders what will happen next and where Adam will be buried. He is concerned about the search warrant and the ongoing investigation.
4. Phyllis Newman has blood on her jacket and is worried about the police finding it. She asks Sharon if she can help her get rid of it.
5. Patty Williams, Jack Abbott's wife, is pregnant. Jack is hesitant to express his excitement due to the recent events with Adam and the chaos in their lives.
6. Lauren Fenmore is kidnapped and being held captive. She tries to reason with her captor, Ryder, and asks if Sheila Carter is alive and making him do this.
7. Jack is a suspect in Adam's murder due to a monogrammed handkerchief found in Adam's throat. The handkerchief is traced back to a Seville row haberdasher in London and has Jack's initials on it.
8. Abby Newman meets Ryder and they bond over their complicated families. Abby shares that her brother Adam was killed in an explosion at the ball, and Ryder shares that his family is also messed up.

1. Genevieve is getting ready to fly to Las Vegas to marry Jack, but she is hesitant due to some unfinished business she needs to take care of. Jack suggests delaying the flight, but Genevieve decides to make her own arrangements and meet him in Las Vegas. She assures Jack that she will be there and that she has high hopes for their marriage.
2. Chelsea reveals to Victor that she is pregnant with Billy's child, which was not part of the plan when she was hired to seduce him. Victor is disappointed and tells Chelsea to leave town as soon as possible. Chelsea refuses and tells Victor that she is giving her baby to Billy and Victoria to raise.
3. Abby, Victoria, and Adam discuss the upcoming arrival of Victoria's baby. Adam mentions that he wants to get something for the baby, but Victoria tells him to stay away. Meanwhile, Harmony is excited to hear that Devon's hearing is improving and that Tucker gave money to the band she used to manage.
4. Michael and Lauren discuss bringing Fen back from Toronto, where he is visiting his brother. Lauren is hesitant, but Michael believes that it is time for Fen to come home. Daisy overhears their conversation and tells them that she is not going anywhere before the custody hearing about Lucy.

1. Victor Newman is investigating the legitimacy of Genevieve Atkinson's purchase of Beauty of Nature cosmetics from Adam Newman.
2. Lauren Fenmore has been arrested for pulling a gun on Daisy Carter after Daisy threatened her son, Fenmore Baldwin.
3. Michael Baldwin is handling Lauren's case and will meet her at the police station with Avery Bailey Clark.
4. Victor has asked Michael to call a commissioner at the S.E.C. to prevent an investigation into his business dealings.
5. Tucker McCall has agreed to lie to the S.E.C. about loaning Genevieve money for the purchase in exchange for a percentage of the sale.
6. Neil Winters confronted Harmony Hamilton about their strained relationship, and they plan to talk.
7. Devon Winters is celebrating his successful music career with his family and friends.

1. The scene opens with Jack, Amber, and Phyllis discussing an anniversary gift for Nick and Phyllis. The gift is a treasure hunt that leads to a GPS device, symbolizing that Nick will always find his way back to Phyllis. Daniel and Amber also discuss their relationship, with Amber expressing her fear of getting her heart broken.
2. Victoria and Adam argue over a business deal that Victor has approved. Victoria is against the acquisition of a natural cleaning products company, but Adam is confident that he can make it a success. Neil, who is also present, praises Adam's talents but warns Victor that his daughter might feel alienated.
3. Jack and Sharon discuss their feelings about Nick and Phyllis's anniversary. Sharon expresses her frustration over the fact that Nick's happiness came at her expense, and Jack reassures her that he feels the same way. They decide to stay home and celebrate each other instead of going back to the office.
4. Daniel and Amber discuss Lily's loss of her baby. They decide not to say anything to her, as she has a lot of people to help her through it. Amber also asks Daniel for help with her universal remote, which he has shown her how to use multiple times.
5. Gloria confronts Jeffrey about staying at Jill's house. She accuses Jill of picking up strays and calls Jeffrey a stray. Jeffrey responds by saying that Jill is very good at a lot of things and that he is glad he traded up. Gloria leaves in a huff, and Jeffrey continues to enjoy his lunch.

1. Genevieve thanks Ethan for his help, but Jill is upset that she has been spending time with him. Genevieve defends her actions, stating that she was a better mother to Ethan than Jill was to Billy.
2. Billy brings Delia to the ranch to see Jill before she leaves for Australia. Jill decides to stay in Genoa City to support Lauren during her trial.
3. Kyle and Eden are interrupted during their breakfast by Billy. Kyle assures him that he is not interested in becoming a father anytime soon.
4. Ricky asks Paul for help in finding a therapist who can treat his anger issues. He admits that his resentment towards his father has led him to make poor decisions in the past.
5. Phyllis calls Daniel to discuss an important matter, but Daisy interrupts their conversation. Daniel visits Daisy and Lucy, and they discuss the possibility of starting a life together.
6. Cane is concerned about Genevieve's legal troubles and suggests that she cut her losses and sell Beauty of Nature. Genevieve is hesitant and considers her options.
7. Michael, Lauren, and Jill meet with Avery to discuss Lauren's trial. Avery agrees to represent Lauren and attempts to negotiate a plea deal with the district attorney.
8. Daniel tells Phyllis that he and Daisy are getting married. Phyllis is shocked and reveals that she is pregnant with Nick's child.
9. Paul asks Avery for her opinion on Ricky's character. Avery describes him as amoral and untrustworthy. Ricky admits to Eden that he tried to trick Phyllis into feeling sorry for him.

1. Michael plans a special evening for Lauren, including a necklace designed by Eric Forrester, to make up for his lack of communication and to apologize for leaving her worried.
2. Cassie starts to remember the accident and realizes she was driving the car when it crashed.

1. Sharon and Nick have a conversation about their past and current struggles. Sharon expresses her feelings about Adam pushing her away, and Nick talks about his concerns with Summer. Sharon mentions that she wants to find a real purpose in life beyond being in love.
2. Michael and Lauren have a heated argument about Lauren's infidelity. Michael is still hurt and angry, and Lauren tries to apologize and make amends. Fenmore overhears the argument and gets upset.
3. Nick and Phyllis discuss Summer's behavior and Nick's concerns about Kyle. Phyllis tries to convince Nick to loosen the reins and let Summer make her own decisions. Nick is still adamant about not letting Summer make mistakes.
4. Dr. Watkins and Sharon discuss Sharon's feelings about Adam and her desire to go back in time. Dr. Watkins reassures Sharon that she can get through her struggles and find a real purpose in life.
5. Kyle talks to Jack about his feelings for Summer. Jack expresses his concerns about Nick's disapproval and suggests that Kyle think twice before pursuing Summer.
6. Summer talks to Courtney about the party and Kyle's behavior. She expresses her excitement about Kyle's interest in her.

1. Chelsea and Chloe have a falling out as Chloe skips her therapy session, which is a violation of her probation. Michael, an officer of the court, is obligated to report this to Paul, but Kevin asks him not to as he wants to take Chloe to Fairview himself.
2. Meanwhile, Nikki has an unpleasant encounter with Ian Ward, who has been released due to lack of evidence. Victor warns Ian to stay away from his family, but Ian provokes him, saying he is free to approach anyone he likes.
3. Dylan is upset that Ian has walked away from the extortion charges and vows to make him pay. Nikki is shaken by the news but tries to stay strong, refusing Victor's offer to take her to the doctor.
4. Paul and Christine celebrate Paul's birthday, but their conversation keeps drifting towards Victor, Nikki, and Ian Ward. Paul expresses his guilt for not realizing Ian's manipulations earlier.
5. Chloe and Kevin have a heart-to-heart conversation about Delia's death. Chloe expresses her regret for the way she treated Kevin and acknowledges that she needs help.
6. Avery and Dylan have a heartfelt conversation about Avery's cooking career and Dylan's past. Avery appreciates Dylan's support and expresses her love for him.
7. Summer meets Austin, a barista at the Crimson Lights, and they bond over their shared experiences of losing a parent. Austin shares his experience of losing his mother, and Summer opens up about her mother's coma.

1. Nick and Cassie have a conversation where they discuss past events and their impact on the present. Nick expresses his regret for letting Cassie go out the night she died and believes that many of his current problems are a result of that decision. Cassie tries to reassure him and help him see that not everything is his fault.

a. Nick expresses his regret for letting Cassie go out the night she died and believes that many of his current problems are a result of that decision.
b. Cassie tries to reassure him and help him see that not everything is his fault.
c. Nick brings up how Daniel was treated and how he wishes he had handled the situation differently.
d. Cassie encourages her father to focus on the present and to try to make amends for his mistakes.

2. Nick and Cassie continue their conversation and discuss the state of his marriage with Sharon. Cassie suggests that Sharon needed support after Cassie's death and Nick realizes that he failed to provide that support.

a. Cassie suggests that Sharon needed support after Cassie's death and Nick realizes that he failed to provide that support.
b. Nick and Cassie discuss the distance that has grown between him and Sharon since Cassie's death.
c. Cassie encourages her father to communicate with Sharon and work on rebuilding their relationship.
d. Nick reflects on how his actions have impacted his marriage and resolves to make changes.

1. Devon paid off Elena's student loans without her knowledge, causing her to feel powerless and indebted to him, leading to a re-evaluation of their relationship.
2. Kevin has been living with Chloe, who faked her death, and is in Genoa City to rescue her from Adam, who has been holding her captive and is now suing Nick for custody of Christian.

1. Kevin announces his plan to move to Portland, Oregon, with his daughter Bella, seeking a fresh start. His friends and family express concern, as he has no connections in the city and Bella will be far from her grandparents. Kevin explains that he needs a change of pace after the traumatic events of the past few weeks, and he feels a sense of calm in Portland.
2. Sharon receives a job offer from Chelsea to return to work at Chelsea 2.0, part-time or full-time. Sharon is flattered but turns down the offer due to her other commitments, including her university courses, volunteering at the crisis hotline, and spending time with her daughter and boyfriend.
3. Victor and Abby discuss the upcoming benefit concert for Nikki's M.S. Research center. Victor expresses his hope that the event will help bring the Newman family back together, as there has been tension between him and Nick. Abby notes that she has not seen Nikki, Victoria, or Nick at the Newman office in a while and expresses her concern about the situation.

Sharon explains that Nick has been putting distance between himself and Victor since finding out that Chloe killed Adam, and Victoria likely feels the same way.
5. Tessa tells Mariah that she told Nick about Nikki's flare-up, which Nikki wanted to keep private. Tessa feels guilty about betraying Nikki's trust, but Mariah reassures her that Nick is loyal to his mother and will not repeat the information to Victor.
6. Nikki tells Nick that she was at a wellness center in Colorado to deal with stress-related issues. Nick is concerned about her pain and wants her to tell Victoria and him if she has another episode. Nikki insists that it was a one-time issue and that she is ready to perform at the concert.
7. Michael and Kevin say their goodbyes as Kevin prepares to move to Portland. Michael expresses his concern about Kevin's impulsive decision, but Kevin insists that he has thought it through and needs to start fresh. 1. Sharon is dealing with the uncertainty of her husband's paternity test results and the possibility that he may choose to be with Phyllis over her.
2. Colleen is struggling with the revelation that her father is being investigated and is receiving threatening messages, causing her to question her trust in him.
3. JT and Paul are making progress in their investigation in Cleveland, but face challenges as they try to uncover the truth about Brad Carlton's past.

1. Victoria is considering job offers from Jabot, Beauty of Nature, and Newman Enterprises, while also considering staying home to raise her son.
2. Adam and Chelsea have eloped and moved into a large, extravagant home.
3. Gloria is trying to determine if Jeff and Anita are legally married, while Ashley confronts Jack about his unorthodox business tactics.
4. Phyllis is worried about how Billy will portray her in the media, while Nick regrets hitting Billy.
5. Kevin confronts Jeff about a second chance, while Cane finds Genevieve crying.

1. Mariah has realized she is in love with Tessa and wants to be with her, even if it means leaving Genoa City suddenly. Tessa has learned that her sister, Crystal, might be leaving the place she's staying, so they need to find her as soon as possible.
2. Devon and Hilary are getting married in the hospital, as Hilary's health continues to decline. Devon is unaware of the severity of her condition, and Hilary wants to keep it that way to have a joyful wedding day.
3. At the wedding, Phyllis and Jack discuss how Devon and Hilary are handling the situation, with Devon unaware of the truth and Hilary trying to make the best of her remaining time. Phyllis is struggling with her feelings about Billy, and Jack reassures her that he will be there for her.
4. Mariah decides to go with Tessa, even if it means leaving her job and life in Genoa City behind. Tessa is grateful but concerned about the risks involved, and Mariah promises to keep their plans a secret.
5. Shauna is worried about Hilary and the secret she's keeping about the car accident. Charlie reassures her, and they hope for Hilary's recovery. Meanwhile, Hilary thanks Nate for saving her life and allowing her to marry Devon.
6. At the wedding, the guests exchange gifts for the bride and groom. Mattie gives Hilary earrings as "something borrowed," and Phyllis gives her a heart-shaped rock as "something old," symbolizing that love is always around.
7. Mariah gives Hilary a joke book as "something blue," hoping to make her laugh. As they prepare for the ceremony, Hilary thanks Mariah for her support and confesses that she's always been proud of Mariah's talent.
8. Just before the ceremony, Hilary loses consciousness. Everyone is shocked and worried, and they wait for her to wake up. Nate explains that she's weakening, but they will keep her comfortable. Devon and Hilary exchange vows, promising to love and cherish each other for the rest of their lives.

1. John is having vision problems and has been taken to the hospital after experiencing a minor stroke.
2. Lily is having a hard time adjusting to being back home and is feeling suffocated by her parents' attempts to act like a happy family.
3. Neil and Dru are arguing about how to handle Lily's situation and Neil has decided that they need to make serious changes in their future.

1. Jack and Sharon discuss a potential article about Victor Newman's death, but Sharon is against it due to the pain it may cause Nick and Noah. Jack argues that they have a responsibility to tell the true story.
2. Cane and Chloe reveal to Jill that they got married, which upsets Jill as she was not invited to the courthouse wedding.
3. Adam offers Brad a position as C.E.O. of Newman Enterprises, believing that they share a similar ruthless approach to business.
4. Nick, Victoria, and J.T. discuss their concerns about their mother's disappearance in Mexico and Paul's efforts to find her.
5. Jill confronts Brad about a scandalous article in "Restless Style" that accuses her of covering up David Chow's gambling problem.
6. Victoria is fired from Newman Enterprises by Adam, who then reveals that he has appointed Brad as the new C.E.O.

1. Murphy, Jill, Lily, Cane, Kevin, and others gather to honor Katherine Chancellor on the anniversary of her passing.
2. Katherine left instructions for the group, asking them to write letters to her and then burn them, with the smoke carrying their thoughts and feelings to her.
3. Neil Winters, who is currently experiencing temporary blindness, is also in attendance and shares his struggles with the group.
4. Victoria Newman is not present at the gathering because she is attending her son Johnny's preschool orientation.
5. Billy Abbott helps Victoria "escape" from the hospital, where she is waiting for paperwork after being given the all-clear by her doctor.
6. The group writes their letters to Katherine and then burns them, with some sharing their letters aloud.
7. Katherine's letter to the group is read aloud, with her expressing her love and gratitude to her friends and family.
8. Victor Newman meets with a doctor who is working to bring Phyllis Summers out of her coma.
9. Nikki Newman becomes emotional during the gathering and is comforted by her husband, Victor.
10. Jill Fenmore has a realization about the music box that Katherine left her and decides to return it to her, thanking her for the journey it represented.

1. Jill has been cleared of any wrongdoing in the S.E.C. investigation and plans to take back control of Chancellor Industries with Cane's help. However, Cane warns her to take it slow and not push too hard. Meanwhile, Kay mistakenly believes that Cane's baby is Lily's, not Chloe's, and Esther is concerned about Kay's memory.
2. Michael agrees to take in Eden, River's daughter, at Lauren's urging. River's attorney, Dick Dentner, is a former activist from the 1960s who has taken on River's case pro bono. Eden is hesitant to stay with Michael and Lauren, but Michael convinces her to stay for her father's sake.

1. Jack resigns from the Abbott-Winters Foundation following his brother Billy's actions, causing concern for the foundation's future and upsetting Neil, who believes Jack is making a mistake. Neil tries to convince Jack to reconsider, emphasizing the importance of holding onto something solid during difficult times, like family and meaningful work. However, Jack is resolute in his decision and leaves.

2. Meanwhile, Billy and Ashley argue about the situation, with Billy placing blame on Jack for his failed marriage with Phyllis. Ashley defends her brother and tells Billy to focus on his own life, reminding him that his actions have affected her both personally and professionally at Jabot. Billy expresses his regret and hopelessness, feeling that he cannot change.

3. In a separate conversation, Hilary advises Jack to consider his next move carefully, acknowledging his desire for revenge but emphasizing that Phyllis is punishing herself more than he thinks. Jack remains adamant that there is no coming back from Billy's betrayal and wishes harm upon him.

4. Victoria discusses her feelings about Billy's new relationship with her mother, Nikki. Victoria admits to feeling a little jealous but is more concerned about her current relationship with Travis. Travis, having moved out, expresses his desire to take a step back to avoid complicating Victoria's life further. Victoria, however, decides that she wants to move forward with Travis and invites him to make their relationship official.

1. A medical team is trying to resuscitate a patient, Damon, who is exsanguinating and in ventricular fibrillation. They are giving him blood, plasma, and medication to try to save his life.
2. Damon sees his son, Elias, who died as a child, and they have a conversation where Elias tells his father that it's not his time to go and that he should let go of his hate and anger.
3. Michael and Kevin are having a disagreement because Kevin wants to fight Michael over Lauren, who is Michael's girlfriend. Michael is trying to talk Kevin out of it, but Kevin is determined to strike back at his brother.
4. Lily is upset because she feels like she keeps making the same mistakes when it comes to men, and she can't stop thinking about her traumatic experience with Alex.
5. Victor is trying to reassure Nikki that his relationship with Ashley is not a threat to their marriage, but Nikki is still suspicious and wants to know what kind of support Victor is offering Ashley.
6. Ashley and Brad are having a difficult conversation where they acknowledge that their relationship is over, and they discuss how to tell their daughter, Abby.
7. Kevin is trying to comfort Lily and assure her that not all men are bad, and that she is not destined to keep making the same mistakes.
8. Nikki and Victor express their love for each other, and Victor asks Nikki to be the bigger person and go easy on Ashley.

1. Chance is being honored for his bravery and awarded a commendation for service above and beyond the line of duty. His family and friends gather to celebrate his achievement, including his girlfriend Chloe.
2. Heather, the prosecutor in Daniel's case, misses the ceremony and later tells Michael that she has a warrant for Daniel's arrest. Michael is shocked and accuses Heather of prosecutorial misconduct.
3. Mac finds out that Billy slept with Kelly and confronts him about it. She ends their relationship, stating that the man she loves no longer exists.
4. Daniel, Kevin, and Jana question Ryder about his relationship with Deacon and the night of the murder. Ryder is uncooperative and withholding information.
5. Phyllis and Amber are worried about Daniel's case and suggest that he leave the country. Michael advises against it and tells them not to think about it.

1. Billy is working on a cover story but needs to take a break to check on Victoria, who is feeling unwell. She might be pregnant, but they are not sure yet.
2. Kevin is watching Delia while Chloe is working, and they plan to go to the Christmas tree lot to take family photos for their Christmas cards.
3. Lily, Cane, and Jill are shopping for Christmas gifts for Mattie and Charlie, and they are excited about the babies' first Christmas.
4. Cane and Blake run into each other at the Christmas tree lot, and Blake mentions that he is there to pick up a new book.
5. Daniel brings Summer to Phyllis's house to decorate a Christmas tree, but Phyllis is hesitant because Daisy is also there.
6. Daisy and Kevin have a conversation about her past and her feelings of loneliness, and Kevin reassures her that he will always be there for her.
7. Victoria picks up Delia from Chloe, and they talk about Victoria's possible pregnancy.
8. Daniel suggests that Daisy let Kevin raise the baby, but Phyllis disagrees and argues that there are people who would be better parents.

1. Hilary and Devon have a heart-to-heart conversation about their relationship and the future of GC Buzz. Hilary expresses her desire to have a successful career, while Devon wants her to come back to the show. Hilary reveals that she has been using her agent, Barry, to make Devon see her value.
2. Jack and Phyllis cross paths at the club, where Phyllis reveals that she is leaving Jabot and has found a new opportunity. Jack seems surprised but also relieved. Meanwhile, Billy stops by Jabot to drop off Christmas presents for his sisters, Traci and Ashley, but Jack refuses to let him in.
3. The Abbott family, including Traci, Ashley, and Billy, spend Christmas Eve together, reminiscing about old memories and enjoying each other's company. Traci and Ashley express their gratitude for having Billy with them, while Billy is touched by their kindness.
4. Gloria makes a surprise appearance at Michael and Lauren's Christmas Eve party, causing tension with Kevin and Chloe. Despite their differences, Gloria and Chloe exchange gifts, and Michael proposes a toast to the true meaning of Christmas.

1. Adam receives a call from Sage, who informs him that Constance, his grandmother, is sick and asking for her grandson. Adam initially dismisses the situation, but Sage reveals that Constance could be dying. This prompts Adam to head to her location.
2. Meanwhile, Nick and Sharon are searching for their missing daughter, Faith, who has run away. They eventually find her at the coffeehouse with Dylan. Sharon expresses her gratitude to Dylan for finding Faith, and Nick calls Paul to inform him of the situation.
3. In a separate conversation, Victor inquires about Ashley's work in the lab. Tobias, who is present, reveals that he has been analyzing Dr. Russell's files and suggests that Victor examine them to find what he's looking for. Victor expresses his frustration with the lack of definitive answers.
4. Ashley and Stitch discuss their one-night stand and agree to hit the "reset" button, returning to being friends and colleagues. Abby overhears the conversation and teases them about their awkwardness.
5. Billy and Victoria discuss their daughter's christening and the naming of their child. Billy is upset that Victoria wants to give their daughter the Newman last name, suspecting that Victor has influenced her decision.
6. Avery informs Dylan that her application to have the warehouse district designated as a historical landmark has been denied, making it more difficult to save the buildings from demolition. Dylan suspects that someone with a lot of power is obstructing their efforts.
7. Joe meets Victor and introduces himself as the representative for the investors in the warehouse-redevelopment project. Victor declines to use his name to draw in other investors, stating that he will attend the cocktail party but not for that purpose.

1. Reed's father, J.T., has come to town for a brief visit and Reed is excited to spend time with him. Reed's parents are divorced, and he has expressed concern about how the divorce has affected him. J.T. and Victoria discuss their past relationships and J.T. mentions that he may try to reconcile with his current wife, Mac.
2. Jack has made an offer to purchase Chancellor Industries, but Billy and Ashley are concerned about the impact on Jabot. Ashley believes that Jack is not thinking clearly and is acting irrationally. The board has issued a no-confidence vote against Jack, but he has not consulted with them about the acquisition.
3. Cane's son, Sam, has been released from the hospital and is coming home. Cane's ex-wife, Lily, has donated blood to help save Sam's life and is struggling with the idea of accepting the baby into her life. Hilary, a former rival of Lily's, has been visiting Cane and Sam in the hospital and has become his "talk-to" for all things baby related.
4. Jill, the current owner of Chancellor Industries, has sold the company to Jack as part of a deal that includes keeping Cane on as an employee and potentially giving him a seat on the Jabot board. Cane is unsure about the arrangement, as he and Jack have a history of not getting along.
5. Reed has been arrested for driving under the influence after drinking at a party. Mattie, Reed's friend, called the police and Reed is upset with her for doing so. Victoria goes to the police station to pick up Reed and is upset about the situation.
6. Nick and Chelsea are discussing plans for a bathroom renovation in their home. Chelsea is hesitant to let Nick cut into her closet space, and Nick wants to add a hot tub to the bathroom. The renovation is a surprise for Chelsea, as Nick wants to build their dream home together.
